-1.title: Episode dated 29 September 2018
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Welcome to the Kitchen
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Cookbook Club
2.plot: Sunny introduces the first inductee of the Cookbook Club"; and receives Jeff's help preparing a beefy ravioli recipe. Also: the hosts reply to viewer tweets; prepare a dish using chicken, kale and quinoa.

3.title: Wings Two Way
3.plot: Sunny and Geoffrey make their favorite wing recipes; and salmon is grilled by Katie Lee and Jeff Mauro. Also: a look inside the hosts' pantries; Marcela Valladolid's recipe for pan-seared pork chops with pineapple and couscous.

4.title: The Big Game
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Easy Fixes for Dinner
5.plot: The hosts demonstrate easy fixes for dinner. Included: Marcela makes chicken empanadas using store-bought pizza dough; Katie turns leftovers into a frittata; and Geoffrey takes care of dessert, preparing a decadent dark chocolate pudding.

6.title: Old Tools, New Ideas
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: The Kitchen on Ice
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

8.title: Conquer and Cook
8.plot: Sunny shares a recipe for creamy chicken succotash using frozen lima beans; Katie and her mom try two no-bake desserts; and Geoffrey prepares a gin cocktail. Also: the chefs cook with pomegranates, ginger and butternut squash.

9.title: The Kitchen Helpline
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Family Traditions
10.plot: The hosts celebrate family traditions. Included: Katie updates her grandfather's stew. Also: Geoffrey's recipe for pesto-rubbed baked salmon with cucumber-and-apple salad.

11.title: The Comeback Classic
11.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

12.title: Ultimate Meatloaf
12.plot: Jeff and Geoffrey work together to prepare the ultimate meatloaf; the hosts cook w/ tofu, eggplant and chilies; and Haylie Duff makes chicken-wrapped dates and herb-mushroom crostini. Also: a grapefruit margarita to celebrate spring.

13.title: Martha Stewart Visits the Kitchen
13.plot: Martha Stewart is on the guest list; Jeff shares his family recipe for blueberry pancakes; Marcela makes spicy oregano burgers, then turns the leftovers into pita sandwiches. Also: nutritious desserts for kids; a "Tool Takedown" segment.

1.title: Spring Show
1.plot: The chefs pays tribute to spring; and Marc Summers chats about his Food Network show, "Rewrapped". On the menu: Sunny's pan-sagna; Katie's idea for leftover pork chops; how to prepare asparagus five different ways.

2.title: Fresh New Food Ideas
2.plot: The hosts share their fresh food ideas, including Jeff's make-ahead sausage-and-egg muffins; Geoffrey's recipe for tagliatelle pasta with artichoke and shrimp. Also: a look at the hottest bar snacks in the U.S.

3.title: Cinco De Mayo with Bobby Flay
3.plot: Cinco de Mayo is celebrated with Bobby Flay and Maile Carpenter. Included: a churro bar and tacos; recipes for shrimp fra diavolo and lime shots.

4.title: Mother's Day Weekend
4.plot: A menu for Mother's Day brunch includes a recipe from Katie for bread pudding, Jeff makes beef braciole, and Geoffrey prepares a creamy lemon tart for dessert. Also: "The Chopped Cookbook".

5.title: Help Is on the Way
5.plot: A recipe for potato salad; new uses for common kitchen tools; foods that get a bad rap; Katie's no-bake strawberry fool; five dishes that are better with an egg on top.

6.title: Weeknight Shortcuts
6.plot: Meal-planning tactics and shortcuts for easier weeknight dinners. Included: Jeff makes BBQ beef nachos; Marcela turns chicken Milanese into sandwiches. Also: picnic tips for summer.

7.title: The Grilling Show
7.plot: Grilling tips are offered by the chefs. Included: Geoffrey makes a cowboy steak; Katie shares pizza recipes; and Sunny demonstrates how to spatchcock a whole chicken. Also: green beans four ways; and a bonfire cocktail.

8.title: Old Fashioned
8.plot: Geoffrey makes charred chimichurri as an alternative to barbecue sauce; and later, prepares a honey-gin cocktail. Also: a "DIY or Buy" segment on croutons and hot sauce; and a new twist on the classic stuffed tomato.

9.title: It's Dad's Day with Rachael Ray
9.plot: The hosts celebrate Father's Day w/a steak-and-eggs burrito; "The Kitchen Toolbox" segment features Rachael Ray & power tools; Marcela prepares a chocolate-stout cake; & Geoffrey makes Negroni cocktail. Also: hot dogs & gift ideas for dad.

10.title: The Chicken Rotisserie Show
10.plot: The hosts treat their crew to fire-roasted chicken; Katie Lee remakes hot dogs during a "Leftover l'over" segment; and kitchen gadgets are tested. Also: Jeff Mauro prepares a "forbidden bite" for guest Wendy Williams.

11.title: The Burger Show
11.plot: The hosts focus their attention on burgers. Included: Geoffrey shares his recipe for the ultimate beef burger; Roger Mooking serves up a delicious cheeseburger. Also: new ideas for sides; how to make flavored ice that's fluffy like snow.

12.title: The Corn Show
12.plot: The hosts talk about different ways to serve summer corn, plus they offer tips for buying and storing fruits and veggies. Also: tamales are made by Marcela; guest Marc Murphy prepares a seafood salad with fresh scallops.

13.title: Summer Party
13.plot: Daniel Radcliffe joins the hosts for a summer party. They play a game of build-a-burger; Katie makes a lo-country shrimp boil; Geoffrey demonstrates a recipe for a watermelon cosmopolitan; design guru Sabrina Soto spruces up the patio.

1.title: So Fresh and So Green
1.plot: Fresh summer fruits and vegetables take center stage when Jeff makes a Grecian grilled chicken salad, and later, the hosts talk about the best kitchen gadgets for produce. Also: five unexpected uses for soy sauce.

2.title: The Staycation Show
2.plot: The hosts share their staycation ideas and show off the global gadgets they have collected on their travels. Included: Jeff cooks an island-inspired jerk chicken; Geoffrey prepares buttery lobster rolls and a strawberry-ginger daiquiri; Katie demonstrates DIY spa treatments; and Sunny throws an easy Korean BBQ party.

3.title: The Get-Together Show
3.plot: Tips for throwing a fantastic party. Included: Sunny prepares a one-pan pork loin; Marcela works with puff pastry; Katie, Jeff and Geoffrey share three simple recipes and then pack them up to survive a car ride. Also: designer Sabrina Soto.

4.title: Summer Snack Show
4.plot: Summer snacks are on the menu. Katie makes something cool and crispy; Marcela demonstrates why her Aztec fruit bars are perfect for road trips; Jeff grills angel-food cake w/peaches and cream; Geoffrey whips up a sparkling peach iced tea.

5.title: Cooking with Your Kids
5.plot: Fun new ways to cook with children; one-stop snacks; Marcela's ideas for edible food crafts; healthy sweet treats. Also: the hosts put their culinary word knowledge to the test.

6.title: Tomato Time
6.plot: The hosts put the tomato in the spotlight. Included: Farmer Lee Jones shares tips and helps Sunny make a chilled soup. Also: sandwich recipes from Geoffrey and Jeff.

7.title: The Barbecue and Grilling Show
7.plot: The hosts share BBQ and grilling tips and recipes as they cook Dino ribs and some great cuts of pork. Also: tasty twists on sides; HGTV's "Kitchen Cousins"; smoking on the barbecue; a bourbon cocktail.

8.title: The Back to School Show
8.plot: The hosts share back-to-school ideas; and spend time with guest Joey Fatone. Included: Sunny's freezer-friendly recipes; new twists on PB and J; how to make the traditional Mexican dish, chilaquiles; tips for packing a lunch box.

9.title: Quick and Easy
9.plot: The hosts share easy ways to add flavor to food. Included: Marcela takes frozen ravioli and turns it into chipotle lasagna; Jeff and Katie demonstrate tricks for adding zest to weeknight meals; Ching-He Huang stir fries kung pao chicken.

10.title: Fresh Fall
10.plot: Fall is celebrated when the hosts highlight the best ingredients of the season, beginning w/ a homemade pumpkin-spice latte shared w/ Food Magazine's Maile Carpenter. Later, Mo Rocca helps Geoffrey make ravioli stuffed w/ short rib.

11.title: Oktoberfest
11.plot: An Oktoberfest celebration starts off with a bratwurst sandwich made by Jeff and Sunny's recipe for red-cabbage kraut. Later, Geoffrey prepares a cocktail called Radlermass; and Katie whips up a Black Forest cake.

12.title: Grown-Up Comfort Food
12.plot: Grown-up comfort food is the theme. On the menu: pork chops braised in apple butter; and short ribs braised in red wine. Also: Geoffrey and Katie prepare two different versions of mac and cheese; and Laura Vitale whips up Italian cannoli.

13.title: Homecoming
13.plot: Tailgating food for homecoming is prepared by Jeff, who shares his recipe for Texas chili con carne. Later, the hosts go over some basic cooking rules; prepare ramen 2 unique ways; demonstrate how to make sweet and savory microwave treats.

1.title: Sweets and Treats
1.plot: The hosts celebrate Halloween. Included: they discuss a strange food trend; spend time with the Maniac Pumpkin Carvers; and transform trick-or-treat candy. Also: a supermarket twist with an eerie twist.

2.title: Souped-Up Soups
2.plot: Soups are prepared throughout the show, beginning w/Marcela's beef stew. Also: the hosts answer viewer questions; offer tips on elevating store-bought soups; review some kitchen gadgets; and sip on Geoffrey's warm Fall- Fashioned cocktails.

3.title: Harvest
3.plot: The hosts prepare harvest-inspired autumn dishes, including pork loin; cauliflower; Nancy Fuller's slow-cooker recipes; "one-stop snacks"; a bourbon-cider cocktail.

4.title: Thanksgiving Prep
4.plot: Make-ahead recipes, shortcuts and tips are shared for Thanksgiving. Also: outrageous turkey trends; a holiday time-line to help with shopping; pumpkin dishes; dessert ideas.

5.title: Thanksgiving Feast
5.plot: The hosts celebrate Thanksgiving by tackling viewer questions and giving out pointers on how to cook the perfect turkey and sides; a no-bake cranberry fluff pie is prepared by Sunny Anderson; Marc Murphy and Alex Guarnaschelli stop by.

6.title: Easy Entertaining
6.plot: The hosts share time-saving tips and slow-cooker recipes for the holiday season. Included: Katie uses Thanksgiving leftovers for a turkey gumbo; and later, she and Geoffrey master the perfect cup of brew at a local coffee shop; Marcela makes enchiladas.

7.title: Deck the Halls
7.plot: Recipes and DIY gift ideas for the holiday season are shared by the hosts. Included: Geoffrey prepares a crown roast of pork with sausage-and-sage stuffing; Jeff and Marcela make Clementine-and-cranberry-glazed Cornish game hens.

8.title: Holiday Time
8.plot: A preview of the movie, Annie (2014), with its star, Quvenzhané Wallis. Also: Sunny's holiday ham; easy hors d'oeuvre recipes; decorating Christmas cookies; instructions for building a champagne tower.

9.title: Healthy Fresh Start
9.plot: Food trends for 2015 are discussed; favorite recipes get lightened up; tips for portion control are offered; and Jeff prepares a veggie lasagna. Also: post-workout snacks; Geoffrey's recipe for Pavlova and a refreshing cucumber cocktail.

10.title: Brunch It Up
10.plot: The hosts do brunch, including Katie's oven-baked Dutch baby recipe; new ideas for pomegranate; tips for using a waffle iron; making eggs Benedict for a crowd; Geoffrey's Bellini recipe.

11.title: Waste Not...
11.plot: Money-saving tips are shared by the hosts, including Sunny's bacon-cheeseburger casserole; tasty ways to serve veggies; dishes that maximize a pantry's potential; what to do w/ the last scoop at the bottom of the jar; Daphne Brogdon.

12.title: Gearing Up for Game Day
12.plot: The hosts share game-day recipes and tips, including Jeff's Italian beef Stromboli; dishes for the slow cooker; three twists on guacamole; and Geoffrey's beer cocktail. Also: Anne Burrell makes turkey burgers.

13.title: Snow Day Cooking
13.plot: Winter favorites are prepared, including cocoa and Geoffrey's recipe for ricotta gnocchi. Also: three potato dishes are given a boost; kitchen gadgets are tested; Marcela offers up a new twist on fondue; Judy Joo makes Korean fried chicken.

1.title: Sweets for Your Sweetie
1.plot: A Valentine's Day celebration features plenty of chocolate, including ideas for edible treats and a decadent martini. Also: a dark chocolate mousse is prepared, along with tender filet mignon with mushroom-red wine sauce.

2.title: Rise and Shine
2.plot: Ideas for breakfast include insta huevos rancheros, three delicious ways to serve oatmeal, a recipe for homemade gravlax, and Geoffrey's healthy green kale-and-grape smoothie.

3.title: Warming Winter Meals
3.plot: Comfort food is featured, including Geoffrey's spaghetti and meatballs and Marcela's ultimate brownie. Also: the hosts talk about maximizing the microwave's potential; chef Amanda Freitag visits with a patty melt recipe.

4.title: Winter Fix
4.plot: Featured: ways to lighten up favorite dishes; Jeff's recipe for chicken-tortellini soup; a basic sauce prepared by Geoffrey; grain bowls; overlooked ingredients; popcorn toppings; and how to make a warm maple-and-rum toddy.

5.title: An Affair to Remember
5.plot: The hosts throw a surprise baby shower for Marcela. Included: tips for making family celebrations special; a recipe for puff pastry-wrapped salmon; DIY hostess gifts; two time-saving side dishes made w/rice; favorite finger-food appetizers.

6.title: Top o' the Morning
6.plot: St. Patrick's Day is celebrated with a twist on corned beef and cabbage. Also: two potato recipes; tipsy treats; and a special holiday cocktail.

7.title: Freezer Fixes and Pantry Staples
7.plot: Shrimp and grits are prepared by Sunny Anderson; Debi Mazar and Gabriele Corcos make the perfect pantry pasta; three recipes for condensed milk are shared; and Geoffrey Zakarian demonstrates how to make a pickleback cocktail.

8.title: Happy Easter!
8.plot: Recipes for Easter are presented, including stuffed pork loin and leg of lamb. Also: chef Johnny Iuzzini's new twist on carrot cake; fun and edible food crafts for the table; ideas for not letting decorated eggs go to waste.

9.title: April Favorites
9.plot: Katie's innovative idea for leftover holiday ham; Sunny's "one pan plan" chicken dinner; fried matzo brei for Passover; no-guilt dessert recipes; and a buying guide for knives.

10.title: Early Spring Entertaining
10.plot: Tiffani Thiessen (Dinner at Tiffani's (2014)) offers tips for an at-home pizza party; Jeff Mauro shares his recipe for blackened hanger steak; and Geoffrey Zakarian demonstrates how to make an herb-infused cocktail. Also: quick and easy snacks for on-the-go.

11.title: Spring Cooking
11.plot: Tips for grilling the perfect chicken breast are shared, when the hosts celebrate Spring. Also: how to use kitchen scraps to grow fresh produce; a guide to dry and wet spice rubs; Gesine Bullock-Prado's recipe for maple-cream pie; and a tipsy sweet tea.

12.title: Fresh Fix-Ins
12.plot: Weeknight meals that are fast and easy are shared by the hosts, who demonstrate how to make the perfect kabob with two complementing sauces. Also: ways to pack flavor into grilled cheese; and a lemony cocktail recipe.

13.title: Spicy Favorites
13.plot: Spicy dishes are featured, including hot chicken. Also: exploring the difference between Tex-Mex and Mexican tacos; chef Marc Murphy's recipe for skirt steak; and how to make a mouthwatering margarita.

1.title: Celebrate Mom
1.plot: Recipes and gift ideas for mom are presented, including a brunch dish of baked eggs with green chilies. Also: fool-proof chocolate chip cookies; two ways to use pesto; a special Mother's Day cocktail.

2.title: Deck Party
2.plot: The hosts grill the perfect steak on their new deck; create a colorful pasta salad with seasonal veggies; and demonstrates two recipes with jarred and fresh artichokes. Also: a segment on compound butter; and instructions for making gin punch.

3.title: Memorial Day Bash
3.plot: Recipes for Memorial Day are shared, as the hosts make burgers, BBQ ribs and unique fries with sweet and savory dips. Also: time-saving tricks for food prep; actor David Burtka's homemade ice cream sandwiches; poolside snacks.

4.title: Backyard Cookout
4.plot: The hosts throw a backyard cookout. On the menu: Alabama white sauce chicken; tequila sunrise; tips for doctoring up store-bought barbecue sauce; Geoffrey Zakarian's grilled lobster; Katie Lee's colorful quinoa side salad.

5.title: Must-Have Meals
5.plot: Kelsey Nixon (Kelsey's Essentials (2010)); Geoffrey Zakarian prepares a braised chicken with caramelized lemons, dates and pine nuts. Also: dishes using pita as an ingredient; a strawberry shortcake recipe; Dr. Travis Stork's advice for curing common summer ailments with food; and tipsy treats.

6.title: Recipes for Success
6.plot: Featured: a no-fail recipe for juicy grilled pork chops and pineapple salsa; using seasonal fruits and veggies to make a grilled summer salad; cookbook author Shauna Sever's honeyed yogurt cheesecake; and a unique way to blend a strawberry daiquiri.

7.title: Father's Day Feast
7.plot: Father's Day is celebrated with smoked Italian sausage hoagies; flank steak fajitas with chimichurri and drunken peppers; and a classic whiskey sour. Also: tips for taking pretzels and chips up a notch; and a recipe for a banana split ice cream cake.

8.title: Summer Celebration
8.plot: The hosts throw a summer celebration. Guests Jamie Deen and Bobby Deen (Southern Fried Road Trip (2015)) stop by with a molasses-marinated London broil. Also on the menu: grilled butterflied chicken with macaroni salad; three party-pleasing dips; edible crafts; a watermelon margarita.

9.title: A Taste of Summer
9.plot: Recipes for summer include a diablo stuffed burger; two different potato salads and the perfect pina cocktail. Also: Kathie Lee Gifford makes a peach-and-rhubarb crostata; tips are given for sprucing up a supermarket flower bouquet; and the hosts share their must-haves items for the beach.

10.title: Summer Staples
10.plot: Marcela cooks steamed clams with chorizo and tequila; the hosts suggest new uses for old kitchen tools; condiment flavors are kicked up a notch; and guest Damaris Phillips demonstrates how to make a buffalo chicken pasta salad. Other segments highlight pineapple, summer s'mores and a rum rickie recipe.

11.title: Summer Seafood
11.plot: Geoffrey Zakarian demonstrates his paella and Royal Blush drink recipes; and the hosts share their beat-the-heat secrets. Also: two summer salad recipes; new ideas for dressing different lettuces; pop-up parties with Nate Berkus; and a guide to grilling fish.

12.title: Pool Party
12.plot: Al pastor-style pork tenderloin is prepared, along with two tomato side dishes. Also: Melissa Gilbert shares her fried chicken recipe; Food Network Star (2005) finalists compete to make the best poolside snacks; and the Bloody Mary receives a summer twist.

13.title: Kid-Friendly Recipes
13.plot: Tips for cooking with kids are offered by the hosts, who also prepare chicken-and-avocado sliders and new takes on ice cream sundaes. Also: John Besh makes an easy school-night dinner; camping party.

1.title: The Kitchen Reveal
1.plot: Season 7 begins with the set newly decorated in fall colors. Recipes include Marcela's seasonal vegetable lasagna, Geoffrey's classic vinaigrette, crab cakes prepared by Katie Lee and cocktail party tips with Erin Cummings.

2.title: Farewell to Summer
2.plot: A Labor Day barbecue features wings two ways, no cream-creamed corn, grilled corn poblano salad, and grilled jumbo shrimp with a 1-2-3 glaze. Also: desserts made on the grill; a frozen raspberry and vodka lemonade; uses for pickle brine.

3.title: Back to School Menu
3.plot: Back-to-school recipe ideas. Included: Geoffrey's quick pasta dinner; Sunny's English muffin pizzas; snacks made with cereal; on-the-go breakfasts; and a celebratory Appletini.

4.title: Fast Fixes
4.plot: Time-saving tips are presented, beginning with Jeff Mauro's 15-minute cold noodle and salmon salad. Also: complete meals are cooked on sheet trays; Marcela Valladolid demonstrates a simple carnitas recipe; food prep hacks; rosemary and thyme chicken with carrots and potatoes. Valerie Bertinelli also stops by.

5.title: First Taste of Fall
5.plot: On the menu: chicken chipotle mac and cheese; mini cupcakes; emergency kitchen substitutes; time-saving bar gadgets; recipes for Brussels sprouts and acorn squash; spirited fall floats.

6.title: Tackle Your Tailgate
6.plot: Football party recipes and tailgating tips. Included: Katie Lee demonstrates how to make her grilled buffalo chicken pizza; race-car driver Danica Patrick prepares cheddar grilled cheese; Geoffrey Zakarian serves a Black Velvet cocktail.

7.title: Autumn Essentials
7.plot: The flavors of fall are in the spotlight. Included: Jeff Mauro's United States of meatloaf; two recipes for winter squash; Moules-frites; tips for a next-level tailgate party; and a guide to whiskey.

8.title: Living for Fall
8.plot: Recipes for roasted chicken, crescent roll dough, flavorful pumpkin seeds and mulled cider are presented. Also: Food Network's Katherine Alford discusses fall trends; the hosts share their favorite kitchen hacks.

9.title: Scary Good Recipes
9.plot: A Halloween party features recipes, crafts and tips. Included: Sunny Anderson's beefy butternut squash chili; ideas for jazzing up supermarket apple cider donuts; Jeff Mauro's "mac-sagna"; and Geoffrey Zakarian's jack-in-the-pumpkin cocktails.

10.title: Flavors of Fall
10.plot: A celebration for fall features chef Ming Tsai making fried wontons with dipping sauce; Jeff Mauro teaching Raven-Symoné (The View (1997)) his recipe for cavatelli and vodka sauce; and Geoffrey Zakarian whipping up a pear-and-bourbon spritz. Also: Mexican chili rellenos.

11.title: Comforting Classics
11.plot: Food Network personalities Amanda Freitag and Nancy Fuller join the hosts, as they prepared comforting classics. Included: truffled mushroom and cheesy mac and cheese; two new twists on banana bread; three slow-cooker hacks; pork on pork; hot buttered rum cocktails.

12.title: Turkey Day Timeline
12.plot: Martha Stewart stops by as the hosts get ready to celebrate Thanksgiving; and Katie Lee visits a cranberry bog during its harvest. On the menu: stuffed mushrooms; a Mexican chocolate-pecan pie; cranberry sweet potatoes; and a Toronto cocktail.

13.title: Tribute to Turkey
13.plot: Thanksgiving tips and recipes are featured, beginning when Katie Lee, Jeff Mauro and Sunny Anderson each prepare turkeys for the holiday. Also: Lidia Bastianich makes a classic chestnut stuffing; and the hosts discuss smart buys in cooking equipment.

1.title: Deck Your Halls with Delicious
1.plot: Season 8 begins with the hosts preparing for the holidays. Included: Jeff Mauro's porcini-rubbed roast beef and two potato sides; new party mix ideas; DIY holiday wreaths made with household items; cheesecake with pomegranate sauce; holiday punch cocktail.

2.title: Cookie Swap Party!
2.plot: The hosts throw a cookie-swap party. Included: Katie Lee's chocolate-peppermint whoopee-pies; Sunny Anderson's mini sugar-cookie tarts; Jeff Mauro's cookie truffles. Also: Duff Goldman demonstrates a recipe for gingerbread cookies; eggnog cocktail; packaging holiday cookies.

3.title: Seasons Eatings
3.plot: Emeril Lagasse visits with a recipe for rack of lamb with apple-mint puree; Katie Lee and Marcela Valladolid create festive cheese balls; and Geoffrey Zakarian makes spirits bright with peppermint hot chocolate.

4.title: Winter Favorites
4.plot: Winter recipes are shared, including a slow-cooker beef stew and two ways to enjoy oatmeal (oatmeal latte and oatmeal risotto). Also: Natalie Morales prepares chocolate flan; and Geoffrey Zakarian serves a Black Russian cocktail.

5.title: Delicious and Nutritious
5.plot: Healthy recipes for the New Year include Katie Lee's turkey Bolognese with veggie noodles and a beet burger with citrus-caper aioli made by Jeff Mauro. Also: vegan chef Chloe Coscarelli prepares chocolate cupcakes with a secret ingredient.

6.title: Bringing Breakfast Back
6.plot: Breakfast is served, including a mimosa sunset cocktail; delicious baked eggs with salami, mozzarella, olives and garlic bread. Also: chef Anne Burrell makes crepes with mascarpone and chocolate with a cherry compote.

7.title: Savor the Savings
7.plot: Money-saving tips are shared, including an economical recipe for pork osso bucco and two weeknight dinner ideas, using affordable chicken thighs. Also: Kardea Brown makes curry-coconut chickpea soup.

8.title: Stuffed
8.plot: Stuffed food recipes are featured, including Marcela Valladolid's picadillo stuffed peppers; Geoffrey Zakarian's chicken breast stuffed with goat cheese and herbs; and food blogger Nicole Friday's French toast stuffed with apple, pear and walnuts.

9.title: Football Feast
9.plot: Hero sandwiches are made for game day, including an eggplant version by Jeff Mauro and Katie Lee's buffalo chicken hoagie. Also: Sunny Anderson's Seattle dog; a potato skins recipe; Texas-style pulled pork.

10.title: Winter Escape
10.plot: Recipes to escape the chill of winter. Included: Sunny Anderson's pork kebabs and baked pineapple rice; Marcela Valladolid's upside-down mango cake; Jeff Mauro's Scorpion Bowl cocktail; and Julius Jackson's Caribbean-style coconut shrimp.

11.title: Chock Full of Chocolates
11.plot: Chocolate is featured in recipes for devil's food cake; crème brulee; pudding pops; cocoa-rubbed strip steak; and a whiskey martini. Also: three innovative ways to create edible flower bouquets. Guests: Joseph Simmons (aka Rev Run) and his wife, Justine Simmons.

12.title: Award Season Party
12.plot: Chef Wolfgang Puck joins the hosts, as they celebrate award season. Included: Jeff Mauro's surf and turf rib-eye crostini with Gorgonzola mousse; sweet and savory popcorn recipes; strawberry-chocolate mini-trifles made by Katie Lee.

13.title: Southern Comforts
13.plot: Katie Lee's favorite comfort foods from West Virginia are on the menu, including fried chicken and sweet tea cocktail. Also: Sunny Anderson prepares easy baked sweet corn; and chef Lazarus Lynch stops by to make his 'bama chocolate mousse.

1.title: Restaurant Favorites
1.plot: The hosts demonstrate how easy it can be to make restaurant food, including stuffed crust pizza with smoked mozzarella and crispy fish tacos. Also: Judy Joo's recipe for pork belly cheesesteak.

2.title: Pi(E) Day
2.plot: The hosts celebrate Pi Day, by making sweet and savory pies. Included: Katie Lee's classic chicken potpie; Sunny Anderson's breakfast pie mashup; Jeff Mauro's lolli-pies; Marcela Valladolid's lemon meringue pie with a twist.

3.title: Spring Spread
3.plot: An Easter celebration includes Jeff Mauro's sausage and spinach bone-in pork loin and an adorable bunny cake. Also: tips for decorating eggs; DIY ideas for spring wreaths; a seasonable risotto recipe from Debi Mazar and Gabriele Corcos.

4.title: Our Tastiest Makeovers
4.plot: Recipe makeovers and tips for kitchen organization are featured; and fashion designer Isaac Mizrahi helps Katie Lee make her cauliflower Alfredo.

5.title: Italian Classics
5.plot: The hosts take on Italian classics. Included: a Sunday gravy recipe from Jeff Mauro; fun crafts using empty wine bottles; interesting ideas for leftovers; Parmigianino monkey bread w/ Soppressata and olives; limoncello; salami cups.

6.title: Steakhouse Favorites
6.plot: The hosts prepare steakhouse favorites, including an herb-roasted beef rib eye with roasted shallots; a wedge salad with a twist; a classic tableside Caesar salad; mini-onion blossoms; and a dirty martini.

7.title: Secrets Show
7.plot: Everyday recipes are taken to the next level. Included: Katie Lee's salmon coated with barbecue potato chips; Jeff Mauro's pickle brined pork chops with sweet and spicy peppers; a French toast showdown between Geoffrey Zakarian and Marcela Valladolid. Also: Candice Kumai makes truffles with dates; and a balsamic bourbon cocktail is prepared.

8.title: Our Cheesiest Show Ever
8.plot: The hosts celebrate cheese. Included: recipes for mac and cheese and grilled cheese; Justin Warner's nacho volcano; the perfect cheese platter; and Geoffrey Zakarian's mousetrap cocktail.

9.title: Spicy Eats and Sweets
9.plot: A Cinco de Mayo celebration includes Marcela Valladolid's flambe tostados; Geoffrey Zakarian's mango picante margaritas; and cookbook author Samantha Seniviratne's crunchy peanut pepper cookies. Also: simple ways to turn the heat up in condiments; rating hot sauces; and adding Buffalo flavor to burritos, potatoes and meatballs.

10.title: Love You a Brunch, Mom
10.plot: Mother's Day is celebrated with a tea party and recipes for Katie Lee's asparagus-and-spinach frittata; Marcela Valladolid's mini club sandwiches with chipotle mayo; and Jeff Mauro's sliders with baked roast beef and provolone. Also: Brooke Burke's offers a tutorial on DIY picture frames; Bridget Moynahan demonstrates how to make her single-serve berry cobblers; and Geoffrey Zakarian toasts mom with a Mamarosita cocktail.

11.title: Easy Breezy
11.plot: Easy, breezy recipes are demonstrated by the hosts. Included: lemon-herb grilled chicken; package parceled cod; two-ingredient desserts; and Geoffrey Zakarian's rum-barb cocktail. Also: suggestions for seasonal greens and dressing pairings.

12.title: Americana
12.plot: America's favorite pastime is celebrated. Recipes include Jeff Mauro's Sonoran-style hot dog; Geoffrey Zakarian's spicy kielbasa dog with stout onions; Katie Lee's crab hush puppies; Sunny Anderson's spicy buttermilk fried chicken and waffles; and former MLB player Sean Casey on the best stadium food. Also: tools for easy fruit salad prep; pro picnic tips: Mikey Likes it Ice Cream.

13.title: Up Your Grill Game
13.plot: The hosts kick off grilling season with double-decker blackened grilled chicken and accordion sweet potatoes; a perfect pasta salad; and toasted coconut-mango bars. Also: a burger showdown between Katie Lee and Jeff Mauro; Lee Schrager's grilled breakfast pizza; and Geoffrey Zakarian's smokin' lemon cocktail.

1.title: Make the Most of Your Summer Bounty
1.plot: In the Season 10 premiere, a grilled pork tenderloin with an apricot serrano salsa is prepared by Marcela Valladolid; and later, Katie Lee uses the leftovers to make quesadillas. Also: tips for keeping produce fresh; tricks for a better backyard; nutritionist Joy Bauer's mini-chocolate-chip ice cream; Chadwick Boyd's radish-and-snap-pea bites with brown-butter-rosemary drizzle; and Geoffrey Zakarian's pina perfected cocktail.

2.title: From Dish to Shining Dish
2.plot: A fried clam roll and Midwestern potato salad are on the menu, along with regional burger recipes from Sunny Anderson, Katie Lee and Marcela Valladolid. Also: barbecue champion Melissa Cookston shares her secret to award-winning sauce for ribs; and actress K.K. Glick helps Geoffrey Zakarian toast the 49th state with a special milkshake.

3.title: Celebrating Dad
3.plot: Father's Day is celebrated. Included: Jeff Mauro makes his ultimate shooter sandwich; Marcela Valladolid takes over the kitchen with her bacon-wrapped jalapeno poppers; and Katie Lee demonstrates her recipe for picante poppers. Also: DIY gifts for dad; ideas for cake and editie bouquets; and special cocktails.

4.title: Pump Up Your Summer Party
4.plot: Entertaining tips and winning recipes for summer get together. Included: Sunny Anderson's classic barbecue chicken; easy sundae sauces for a Fourth of July dessert bar; Melba Wilson's crab boil; Geoffrey Zakarian's molito makeover; and backyard water slide bowling. Also: Katherine Alford answers summer party questions.

5.title: Stove-Free Summer
5.plot: Stove-free recipes are demonstrated, including Katie Lee's Asian chicken noodle salad; Geoffrey Zakarian's slow-cooker mussels with creamy wheat beer and German mustard; and Jeff Mauro's Thai mussels. Also on tap: microwave asparagus; Monti Carlo's coconut mug; and Sunny Anderson's water balloon game.

6.title: Summer Cookout
6.plot: A summer cookout features Katie Lee's salmon burger with kale slaw and Jeff Mauro's creamy Greek orzo salad with crispy chickpeas. Other recipes include white peach sangria; toppings for grilled donuts.

7.title: Summer Games
7.plot: The Summer Olympic Games inspire Jeff Mauro's Brazilian hot dog; Sunny Anderson's easy BK curry; Katie Lee's hot dog with a banh mi twist. Also: chef Raiza Costa makes a unique roasted strawberry and cream milkshake; and Marcela Valladolid prepares a Mexican shrimp burger.

8.title: Chill Out
8.plot: Cool summer recipes include cilantro pesto pasta salad; sweet corn gazpacho; chilled "beet" the heat soup; no-bake s'mores; and frozen blueberry daiquiri. Also: ways to elevate iced coffee; cookout tips.

9.title: Wrapped and Rolled
9.plot: Recipes that are wrapped and rolled include prosciutto-wrapped chicken breast; a horizontal chicken shawarma wrap; cookbook author Nikki Dinki makes zucchini taco wraps. Also: tips for making burritos and spring rolls; the art of gift wrapping; and Geoffrey Zakarian's Engaged but Cantaloupe cocktail.

10.title: Kitchen Academy
10.plot: Recipes for easy pizza and banana bread are included. Also: tip on how to make kids' lunch box foods into crafts and cocktails; The Jungle Book (2016) star Neel Sethi helps Geoffrey Zakarian prepare burrata ravioli with fresh tomato sauce; and Justin Warner suggests some edible science experiments.

11.title: High Five
11.plot: Five ingredients dishes. Included: mess-free Mexican shrimp; Mediterranean salmon foil packs; spicy sausage carbonara; quick sausage gumbo; Haylie Duff's open-face baguette with baked Brie and port-soaked cherries. Also: beer trends; table setting styling tips and an Ipaloma cocktail.

12.title: Summer Bucket List
12.plot: A celebration, in honor of the end of summer, features Katie Lee's grilled paella; tips from party planner Mary Giuliani; Jeff Mauro's crispy crunch pig candy Sriaracha baked beans; Adam Richman's twist on flank steak; and Geoffrey Zakarian's Kickin' Bucket cocktail.

13.title: Recipe Free Show
13.plot: It's a recipe-free episode, when Jeff Mauro makes his spaghetti and meatballs by heart, and Geoffrey Zakarian goes by memory for his Asian pot pie and red wine spritzer. Also: Katie Lee shares a tip for remembering easy ratios for any fruit crisp; and Marcela Valladolid teaches bouquet and centerpiece basics.

1.title: Pantry Raid
1.plot: Must have pantry items are suggested by the hosts, as they make simple recipes, including sheet tray chicken stir-fry and sheet chicken with basil and Peccrino Romano. Also: sensational appetizer ideas; canned tuna fish dishes; a decadent cake from a box mix; and Geoffrey Zakarian Rob Roy cocktail.

2.title: Autumn Eats
2.plot: Fall is celebrated with food trends and recipes, including Sunny Anderson's cornbread-stuffed fried pork chops; homemade pumpkin spice latte mix; Marcela Valladolid's apple slab pie; a slow-cooker caramel apple bar; and a Dutch apple pie cocktail from Geoffrey Zakarian. Also: tips for decorating pumpkins.

3.title: Tailgating 2.0
3.plot: Tailgate season is celebrated with recipes for Katie Lee's slow-cooker buffalo chicken chili; Sunny Anderson's cheese and charcuterie; and Daina Falk's beer snow cones. Also: Alton Brown's offers the gang a challenge; and boozy hacks for game day are presented.

4.title: Weeknite Warrior
4.plot: Five easy make-ahead dishes. Included: Jeff Mauro's pasta al fauno with chicken sausage and rapini; a stir fry with store-bought ingredients; Geoffrey Zakarian's "cheat sheet" fajitas; and a golden chicken pasta recipe from Robin Chapman. Also: tips for upgrading frozen pizza; a mocktail for the whole family; and walking stiMauros.

5.title: Fall Into Brunch!
5.plot: Autumn favors are added to brunch recipes. Included: a decadent pumpkin French toast casserole; breakfast nachos with a base of waffles; Tregaye Fraser's bacony breakfast cupcakes; smoothies inspired by fall desserts; and a seasonal mimosa.

6.title: Halloween Tricks and Treats
6.plot: The folks of the kitchen host a cakewalk with Spooky Pumpkin Patch Cake as the prize and make delicious food party crafts; the gang creates last-minute DIY food costumes; Food Network Star Kids (2016) winner Amber Kelley shares her sweet Candy Fondue.

7.title: Warm Up for the Season
7.plot: The gang creates kitchen-warming recipes; chef Franco Noriega puts a new spin on a classic protein with his Peruvian chicken; getting holiday-ready with tips on prepping a baking pantry, seasonal ideas for the home and innovative hostess gifts.

8.title: Friendsgiving
8.plot: The Kitchen hosts a star-studded Thanksgiving with Nancy Fuller and Valerie Bertinelli, complete with a lemon and herb-roasted turkey; a creamy root-vegetable one-dish side; the ultimate mac and cheese; pumpkin pie with homemade whipped cream; berry Kir Royale; the kitchen helpline is open for Turkey Day questions.

9.title: Ultimate Guide to Sides
9.plot: The folks in the kitchen whip up everyone's favorite Thanksgiving side dishes and share tips for making enough room in the oven for all of them; special guests join the gang for a holiday toast.

10.title: Holiday Cocktail Party
10.plot: Jeff Mauro's Merry Mauro cocktail; a festive meatball bar; DIY tricks for Christmas tree décor; Geoffrey Zakarian makes an appetizer with store-bought brie; Elise Strachan makes her Christmas Tree Surprise Cake; fragrant place cards.

11.title: Merry and Bright Ideas
11.plot: Marcela Valladolid teaches how to set a sparkling holiday table; Jeff Mauro's seasonal orange-cranberry wreath cake; Geoffrey Zakarian makes a flame of love cocktail; manners expert Thomas Farley gives party etiquette advice.

12.title: Winter Lodge
12.plot: To ward off the winter chill, Jeff Mauro makes some hot tub chicken; Marcela Valladolid and Sunny Anderson make two delicious fondue recipes; Geoffrey Zakarian makes French onion soup; Katie Lee prepares hot chocolate bread pudding.

13.title: Champagne Brunch
13.plot: Marcela Valladolid makes mushroom sausage strata; Katie Lee makes sparkling parfait; cookbook author Jenny Rosenstrach makes New Year's pancakes; Jeff Mauro and Sunny Anderson make a toast bar; Geoffrey Zakarian's Resolution Resolved cocktails.

1.title: Fix Up Your Favorites
1.plot: Jeff Mauro shares his recipe for a lightened-up stuffed mushroom lasagna; Katie Lee makes her delicious cauliflower fried rice; vegetable toast; the pass the burrito bowl; healthy super food milkshake.

2.title: Like a Chef
2.plot: Geoffrey Zakarian's Coq Au Vin; Jeff Mauro whips up tiramisu; the perfect poach; chef Scott Conant shares the secret to the perfect gnocchi; the Kitchen helpline; Geoffrey demonstrates how to make the perfect cocktail garnish

3.title: Bang for Your Buck
3.plot: Tips on getting the most bang for a buck; Sunny Anderson's meatloaf al pastor; stem-to-peel recipes; upcycling everyday household items; Jeff Mauro's slow cooker corned beef; Spike Mendelsohn's jug black sangria.

4.title: Big Game Day
4.plot: The hosts share big ideas for a big-game party; an epic sub sandwich made three ways; how to decorate with nothing more than a roll of tape; the Feltner Brothers share secrets for an ultimate burger bar; Katie Lee's sizzling chili-cheese skillet dip; Olivia Culpo's creamy buffalo chicken-stuffed French bread; a michelada cocktail recipe.

5.title: Order Up!
5.plot: Secrets to making favorite restaurant food at home; Geoffrey Zakarian's tips for a delicious shrimp scampi; The Kitchen Helpline; Deuki Hong and the Dos Toros Brothers share their recipes for slow cooker Korean short ribs and steak quesadillas.

6.title: Chocolate Overload
6.plot: Katie Lee's decadent chocolate-covered strawberry tart; Brownie 101; brownie bombs; Valerie Gordon's pot de crème; surprising chocolate pairings; the Kitchen Helpline.

7.title: Game Night
7.plot: Sunny Anderson's nunya business pizza pasta pie; new ways to add flavors to favorite appetizers; Katie Lee's jackpot game night dip; Marcus Samuelsson's wild wild wings; new ways to decorate for game night; food flip.

8.title: Most-Searched Comforting Classics
8.plot: Favorite comfort food dishes; Geoffrey Zakarian makes savory short ribs; Jeff Mauro's two twists on chicken pot pie; the verdict on bad kitchen habits; buffalo mac and cheese; Katie Lee's Italian style meatloaf; pairing a cocktail with dessert.

9.title: Winter Weeknight Warrior
9.plot: Jeff Mauro's pierogi reuben skillet dish; Sunny Anderson's honey chipotle bean burritos; Katie Lee's time-saving lasagna soup; the best way to buy pre-prepped ingredients for a spicy chicken stir fry; easy dessert ideas; two-ingredient cocktails.

10.title: Easy Does It
10.plot: Geoffrey Zakarian's simple salmon stir fry cheat sheet; testing kitchen tools; chef Jordan Andino shares his chicken adobo tacos; Sunny Anderson's one pan pasta; Katie Lee's chocolate peanut butter banana bread; Jeff Mauro's banana bread biscotti.

11.title: Spring Pantry
11.plot: The Kitchen does a pantry makeover; Sunny Anderson turns microwavable rice into chicken fried rice casserole; Katie Lee makes berry crisp dump cake; author Hilaria Baldwin stops by to make a grain bowl and teach some kitchen yoga moves.

12.title: Cheese, Please!
12.plot: Jeff Mauro's ultimate cheese enchiladas; Sunny Anderson's cheesy cornbread muffins with jalapeno glaze; David Burtka makes a four cheese pizza; the Kitchen Helpline; the hosts play Try or Deny with new cheese products; a grilled cheese pull contest.

13.title: Bottomless Breakfast
13.plot: Katie Lee makes breakfast-for-dinner mac and cheese; Jeff Mauro whips up German chocolate French toast cake for dessert; on-the-go breakfast hacks; egg shop chef Nick Korbee joins the hosts to make green eggs and ham; a new take on the classic mimosa.

1.title: Spring Feast
1.plot: Marcela Valladolid makes a savory spring roasted rack of lamb; techniques for decorating Easter eggs; making food-inspired bouquets; carrot cake trifle made with store-bought cake mix; chef James Briscione makes spring vegetable salad.

2.title: Spring Chicken
2.plot: Katie Lee makes roast chicken with a twist; the Rotisserie Club kicks off with Jeff Mauro's pulled chicken sandwich; chef John Seymour grills honey garlic chicken thighs; The Kitchen Helpline; Geoffrey Zakarian serves up a mint julep.

3.title: Hit Re-Fresh
3.plot: Geoffrey Zakarian makes pork chops with spring vegetables; Marcela Valladolid makes apple peel snacks; Jeff Mauro makes veggie top pesto; Sunny Anderson makes matchstick fries with mint; Katie Lee makes parmesan green beans fries; Marcela also makes churro cupcakes.

4.title: What's Hot Right Now
4.plot: Jeff Mauro makes risotto scampi fra diavlo; Sunny Anderson makes sunset park noodle bowl; chef Michael Psilakis makes spicy chicken tacos; spicy food predictions from around the world; The Kitchen Helpline; spiced up fruit; Geoffrey Zakarian makes caliente colada.

5.title: Celebrate Good Times
5.plot: Katie Lee makes surf and turf skewers; Tregaye Fraser shares two easy chicken recipes; Sunny Anderson makes a dessert pizza; Geoffrey Zakarian makes key lime pie punch; Marcy Blum shares the latest party trends; Marcela Valladolid makes a photo booth.

6.title: Toast to Mom
6.plot: The Kitchen (2014) celebrates Mother's Day; Geoffrey Zakarian make Chamomile French toast; Katie Lee makes mini-broccoli quiches; Bloom School is in session with three new floral arrangements; the gang plays Pass the Chicken Salad.

7.title: Fresh New Flavors
7.plot: The Kitchen (2014) explores new flavors; Sunny Anderson's Bruschetta burger; Katie Lee's barbecue salmon Cobb salad; creating fresh, seasonal dishes is easy with a Field Guide to Greens; Marcela Valladolid starts the Kitchen's herb garden.

8.title: Get Your Grill On
8.plot: The hosts get their grills ready for spring and put some gadgets to the test; Jeff Mauro makes grilled braciole; Marcela Valladolid makes grilled cold slaw; Shannon Ambrosio makes grilled jerk chicken; Geoffrey Zakarian makes smoking Margarita.

9.title: Serve Up Some Summer
9.plot: Welcoming flavors of summer; Katie Lee's grilled shrimp fajitas; Marcela Valladolid's cheesy corn skillet dip; some of the worst barbecue habits; chef Ryan Scott makes a chocolate brownie pie; Jane Francisco serves up a Moscow mule.

10.title: Summer Sides
10.plot: Sunny Anderson makes an easy T-bone steak and potato salad; the hosts dress up side dishes with designer dressing; Jeff Mauro builds a better pasta salad; Jessie James Decker makes fresh couscous salad; a new way to add flavor to cocktails.

11.title: Throw a Party for Your Pop
11.plot: Kicking off Father's Day celebrations with Marcela Valladolid's sausage-and-bacon pancakes; Sunny Anderson's Maui luau burger; Willie Geist makes grilled pizza with Katie Lee; replace traditional Father's Day gifts; toast with dad-inspired cocktails.

12.title: All Deck'd Out
12.plot: Outdoor deck entertaining; Geoffrey Zakarian's sausage grinder with peppers and onions; Katie Lee makes a seafood pasta; Marcela Valladolid's grilled Caesar salad; Katie's pina colada poke cake; and Geoffrey's Pineapple Breeze cocktail.

13.title: Patriotic Party
13.plot: Jeff Mauro's Short Rib Burger with Dijoli; Katie Lee and Sunny Anderson take hot dogs to the next level; lifestyle blogger Rachel Hollis' Red, White and Blue Pretzel Salad; no-fail party prep ideas; and a DIY confetti cannon.

14.title: Grillin' and Chillin'
14.plot: Marcela Valladolid makes her grilled adobe rubbed chicken; Jeff Mauro and Geoffrey Zakarian use the leftovers to make a jalapeno popper melt and chicken nicoise salad; Jeff and Sunny Anderson infuse fruit with cocktail flavors.

15.title: Burger Bliss
15.plot: Geoffrey Zakarian makes his Iron Chef burger; Marcela Valladolid serves up a tuna burger with chipotle slaw; Jeff Mauro puts a flavorful spin on a chicken burger; Aaron McCargo Jr. makes his locked and loaded chorizo burger; blueberry pie milkshake to wash it all down.

16.title: Down Home Cooking
16.plot: Katie Lee's low country seafood boil; Geoffrey Zakarian's summer succotash; DIY hostess gifts with Southern flair; learning new tricks from old tools; Ree Drummond (The Pioneer Woman (2011)) makes her blueberry cobbler; Geoffrey mixes up a southern peach juice.

1.title: Perfect Plate of Summer
1.plot: Sunny Anderson makes her London broil with tomato and fennel; Katie Lee serves up bacon and ranch potato salad; three new toppings for grilled corn; answering summer cookout questions; frozen vanilla lemonade.

2.title: Poolside Party
2.plot: New ideas for hot dog toppings; fresh barbecue chicken slaw; blogger Sharzad Kiadeh shares her recipe for Edible Cookie Dough Pops; great ways to use watermelon; Geoffrey Zakarian serves a Watermelon Shanty around The Kitchen's Kiddie Pool Fountain.

6.title: Kids' Eats
6.plot: Easy cheesy bacon Salisbury steak snack attack with Margaret Zakarian; taking tater tots to the next level; ice cream lasagna; two of the hottest kids' crafts; making candy-quariums and a mermaid lemonade refresher.

7.title: Summer Sendoff
7.plot: Grilled lobster and shrimp tacos; making summer favorites last all year round; two fresh summer salsas; Sasha Pieterse (Pretty Little Liars (2010)) makes lemon filo bites; how to preserve herbs; the summer's trendiest beers.

8.title: Hot New Tricks
8.plot: Hottest new tips and tricks for summer cooking; barbecue beer can burger; gnocchi pesto pasta salad; chef Ronnie Woo makes his no-bake s'mores ice cream pie; fresh new ways to use up summer zucchini; three twists on frozen cocktails.

9.title: Fast and Flavorful
9.plot: Mexican chorizo meatloaf; andouille sausage and rice pot; chicken souvlaki; flavor bomb ice cubes.

10.title: Quick and Easy Fall Favorites
10.plot: Chicken chili; seasonal fall stir fry; cheesy chicken pasta with broccoli and bacon; caramel apple bomb pie; pear bubbly.

11.title: Master Your Menu
11.plot: Sloppy joes; hot and crispy fish sandwich; a Greek chicken skillet with supermarket shortcuts; and chef Jet Tila stops by to make an easy Asian beef with broccoli dish; white pizza; Mexican cola float.

12.title: Party in the Parking Lot
12.plot: Celebrating tailgating season with Jeff Mauro's Greek bread pizza and Katie Lee's Jerk Chicken Nachos; Marcela Valladolid and Sunny Anderson share hot dog recipes and Iron Chef Showdown's Jaymee Sire joins in the fun to make Skip N' Go Jelly Shots.

13.title: Fall Brunch Strikes Back
13.plot: Sunny Anderson makes Funky Monkey Bread Pudding; Jeff Mauro and Katie Lee share recipes for Pancake Tacos; adding new flavors to amp up oatmeal; chef Meny Vaknin serves Mediterranean Eggs; Geoffrey Zakarian serves Apple Cider Brunch Punch.

1.title: Spooky Surprises
1.plot: Treats for Halloween; Jeff Mauro's monster mac and cheese; Katie Lee's butternut squash soup; frightening food crafts; pass the cauldron cake; the piece of cake Halloween party is packed with great ideas and a Shirley Temple of doom.

2.title: Feast of Fall Flavor
2.plot: Fall flavors are featured, including Katie Lee with creamy chicken and dumplings; Aarti Sequeira with a roasted root jumble; Sunny Anderson with easy slow cooker sauerbraten; Jeff Mauro and Geneva Carr with Mauro's apple crumb cake; sweet and savory pumpkin seeds and squirrel's stash cocktails.

3.title: Our Best Fall Finds
3.plot: 'Sunny Anderson's red eye beef stew; Geoffrey Zakarian's Thai fried rice cauliflower; squash recipes like Katie Lee's toad in a hole and Jeff Mauro's squacho cheese sauce; cookbook author Raquel Pelzel's sheet pan mac and cheese; the hosts share pumpkin décor ideas; Geoffrey Zakarian's pear cocktail with a peppery twist.

4.title: Just Desserts
4.plot: Satisfying every sweet tooth with holiday desserts; Geoffrey Zakarian's quick caramelized apple tart; what tools are must-haves for the best baked goods; turn a classic dessert into a molten masterpiece with the molten banana foster cake.

5.title: Friendsgiving Feast
5.plot: The Kitchen hosts a star-studded Friendsgiving feast; Sunny Anderson's "Sunny, who pecanned my bird" bird; homemade green bean casserole; "dressed up" mac and cheese; Trisha Yearwood makes lemon pecan slab pie; edible Thanksgiving centerpieces; gobble gobble punch.

6.title: Turkey Day Tricks
6.plot: Turkey Day tricks and recipes are shared. Included: Geoffrey Zakarian's bone-in turkey breast with lemon caper sauce; Katie Lee's sweet potatoes; Jeff Mauro's cranberry sauce and Geoffrey Zakarian's pumpkin pie; chef James Briscione makes a pumpkin pie crumble; apple walnut stuffing; answering important Thanksgiving questions; Moscow turkey;

7.title: Full House for the Holidays
7.plot: Santa's sausage and snow strata brunch; tips for prepping meat and cheese board; chocolate raspberry bundt cake; chorizo-stuffed pork loin; winter wonderland crafts for the kids; two nightcaps -- one naughty and one nice.

8.title: A Festive Family Feast
8.plot: Sticky apricot drumsticks; shaved Brussels sprout salad with pomegranate vinaigrette and pecans; pappardelle with sausage and beef Bolognese; how to dress up holiday cookies; fireside brulee coffee.

9.title: Jolly Good Holiday
9.plot: Beef tenderloin with blue cheesy Yorkshire puddings; easy garlicky lemon butter green beans; mashed potatoes gratin; gingerbread house cookie cake; mulled cranberry punch.

11.title: Hearty and Healthy
11.plot: The Kitchen makes flavorful and veggie-packed recipes; Jeff Mauro shares his chicken pot pie with butternut squash gravy and Katie Lee adds her chicken alfredo spaghetti squash boats to the menu.

12.title: Flavors That Whisk You Away
12.plot: The gang takes a tropical trip; slow cooker Hawaiian pulled pork; hash brown crusted halibut; Puerto Rican-style cilantro citrus roasted chicken; a flavor guide to citrus with recipes for citrus avocado salad and grapefruit coconut cooler.

13.title: Dining on a Dime
13.plot: The Kitchen hosts share tips for money-saving meals and dollar-saving deals, starting with Sunny Anderson's meat n' potatoes bundt loaf; breaking down your shopping cart and determining the best places to buy common grocery items.

1.title: Game Day Grub
1.plot: BBQ pork slow-cooker chili; two new ideas for wrapped appetizers -- a cubano in a blanket and a meatball parm in a blanket; molasses gochujang chicken wings; meaty cheesy slider casserole; best tips for the ultimate game day dips.

2.title: Diner Favorites
2.plot: Disco fries; patty melt and secret for creamy coleslaw; lemon meringue pie; tricks for crispy meatloaf, easy hollandaise sauce and hash browns in a diner edition of Kitchen helpline; peanut butter and jelly milkshake.

3.title: Sweet Surprises
3.plot: Valentine's Day food, crafts and sweet surprises; hidden heart cakes; food-inspired Valentines; snack mix brownies; sour cream swirl brownies; a box of chocolate cake; pasta pomodoro; Mamrie Hart's French kiss 75 cocktail.

4.title: Snowed In
4.plot: Sunny Anderson's triple-decker E.A.B.L.T.; sweet potato and corn chowder; sweet desserts in mugs; crispy Cajun popcorn shrimp and cheesy grits; delicious snow-inspired crafts; hot tequila toddy and a winter warm-up game.

5.title: A Hug on a Plate
5.plot: Geoffrey Zakarian's beef stroganoff; Katie Lee's vegetable manicotti; Jeff Mauro puts his spin on a takeout favorite with his General Tso's crispy chicken sandwich; the winner of the 48th Pillsbury Bake-Off Contest demonstrates her winning recipe.

6.title: 13 x 9 and Feelin' Fine
6.plot: Recipes to warm up winter nights include Sunny Anderson's beef Wellington casserole; Geoffrey Zakarian's baked sweet potato and carrot gratin; Jeff Mauro's lemon chicken and orzo casserole, and Katie Lee's spicy Thai red curry chicken casserole.

7.title: Family Night In
7.plot: Family favorites include crispy Detroit-style pepperoni pizza; everyone shares simple snack ideas with only one, two or three ingredients; cookbook author Siri Pinter Daly prepares Greek nachos; Katie Lee serves up ice cream sundae bonbons.

8.title: Weeknight Wonders
8.plot: Shortcuts to weeknight meals start with Katie Lee's one-pot beef bourguignon; Jeff Mauro makes an eggplant parm cheat sheet; Geoffrey Zakarian serves up galette; cookbook author Elizabeth Heiskell makes chocolate cobbler with cherry ice cream.

9.title: Fresh Festive Feast
9.plot: Sunny prepares grilled lamb chops with a re-cook orange chutney; Katie makes roasted carrots with honey and mint; Lidia Bastianich celebrates the season with orecchiette with asparagus and peas; Scott Conant shares spruced up spring appetizer tips;

10.title: A Whole Lotta Pasta
10.plot: Plates are piled high with pasta, starting with Geoffrey's cacao e pepe and Jeff's spinach, walnut, and golden raisin pesto pasta; Sunny helps comic Kevin Fredericks prepare Grandma's mac and cheese; chef Christian Petroni serves spaghetti with clams.

11.title: Have the Best Birthday
11.plot: Katie makes porterhouse steak with herb fries; Geoffrey's shrimp bruschetta and Sunny's mini pita pizza prove to be fun finger foods for any occasion; baker Melissa Ben-ishay creates birthday magic with a tie-dye birthday cake;

12.title: Let's Do Lunch
12.plot:

13.plot:

1.plot: The cast are making Mexican food.

2.title: Garden of Eatin
2.plot:

3.title: For the Love of Mom
3.plot: The Kitchen is serving up a Mother's Day lunch, which includes salmon en papillote with tapenade, an orzo salad, a frittata with spinach, olives and chicken salad, and a lemon poppy seed Bundt cake with strawberry glaze.

4.title: Get Out and Cook
4.plot: Grilled spinach and artichoke-stuffed chicken; Sunny Anderson's Migas Verde; Geoffrey Zakarian shares a recipe for grilled asparagus that uses only five ingredients; Katie Lee has a hack for a meaty grilled pizza; summer salad with melon and spinach;

5.title: Red, White and BBQ
5.plot: Katie Lee whips up her Beastie Burger; Sunny Anderson makes a twist on a classic with her grilled chicken and corn pasta salad; Geoffrey Zakarian prepares grilled shrimp cups with aioti; chef Roger Mooking stops by with his chicken wing skewers;

6.title: Stove-Free Summer Nights
6.plot: Whole chicken with red bliss potatoes, summer squash and chili garlic butter; former White House chef Sam Kass serves up a quick and easy canned salad; bloody Mary shrimp ceviche rice bowl;

7.title: Pour on Some Summer
7.plot: Sweet and spicy grilled chicken and cucumber salad; seared scallops with a caper honey sauce; jazzing up grilled chicken with lemon pepper sauce and cherry pepper honey mustard; pit masters Jason and Megan Day make a barbecue-inspired potato salad;

8.title: Man's Best Food
8.plot: Father's Day favorites include grilled brewed awakening rib roast with 1-2-3 horseradish sauce, roasted Mexican street corn salad, grilled barbecue Buffalo wings, and a sausage-and-peppers burger;

9.title: Raise the BBQ
9.plot: Honey-glazed pork belly burnt ends; peach bourbon baked beans; easy apple slaw with apple-jalapeno dressing; pit master Moe Cason brings the heat with his Memphis-style barbecue chicken thighs; Gesine Prado makes a blackberry cornbread cake;

10.title: Fireworks of Flavor
10.plot: Sunny Anderson's steak supreme; Jeff Mauro's cheesy and spicy Reuben-style brats; Katie Lee put her twist on a restaurant appetizer with her grilled firework onion; Iron Chef Michael Symon grills up his blackberry barbecue chicken;

11.title: Summer Weeknight Warrior
11.plot: Geoffrey Zakarian's orecchiette with shrimp and corn; Katie Lee's grilled chicken and kale Greek salad; Sunny Anderson shares a supermarket fix to make chicken cheesecake; Donal Skehan drops by to make a spicy steak noodle bowl;

12.title: No-Sweat Summer Party
12.plot: Citrus grilled turkey breast made with pineapple marmalade; sweet potato salad; party prepping is made easy with three no-fail strategies; Geoffrey Zakarian whips up a shareable party plate of spicy Mediterranean cauliflower fries;

13.title: Summer of Seafood
13.plot: Jeff Mauro's Escovitch-style mahi-mahi sandwich with mango aioli; Katie Lee's fried shrimp; Sunny Anderson cooks up five-ingredient mussels with garlic parsley fries; Geoffrey Zakarian makes a decadent crab spaghetti with zucchini and basil;

1.title: Summer Dinner of Your Dreams
1.plot: Serving up some of summer's best flavors; Katie Lee's cornbread panzanella and Geoffrey Zakarian's P-L-T burger with pancetta; corn gets toppings with Sunny Anderson's creamy and spicy Boom Boom corn and Jeff Mauro's crunchy ranch corn;

2.title: Summer Plate-List

3.plot:

4.title: A Kid-Friendly Feast
4.plot: It's easy to turn favorite foods into kebabs, like Jeff Mauro's French toast kebabs, Geoffrey Zakarian's PB and J kebabs and Sunny Anderson's hot dog and pretzel kebabs; the hosts Pass the Pizza Cake with Jeff's son, Lorenzo Mauro, and Geoffrey's daughters, Anna Zakarian and Madeline Zakarian;

5.title: Summer Block Party
5.plot: The Kitchen throws a summer block party bash; Jeff Mauro grills up crowd-pleasing smoked crispy drumsticks with maple butter hot sauce; TV host Sunny Hostin (The View (1997)) drops by with her side dish, a shrimp, corn and bean salad;

6.title: Last Call for Summer
6.plot: The Kitchen savors one last bite of the flavors of the summer, starting with Katie Lee's French onion burger and Jeff Mauro's whole barbecued cauliflower; food writer Alison Roman bakes pistachio-plum crisp; Katie throws an ice cream party;

7.title: Freshen Up Your Favorites
7.plot: The Kitchen stirs up weeknight favorite recipes, like Geoffrey Zakarian's Mediterranean steak and potatoes; Jeff Mauro's steps up classic red sauce with a one-pot super easy fusilli; Gaby Dalkin takes over taco night with a taco skillet bake;

8.title: Supper in a Snap
8.plot: The Kitchen has quick and easy meals tailor-made for a busy schedule; Sunny Anderson's garlic knots and easy pasta bake; Katie Lee's curried shrimp and corn chowder; Geoffrey Zakarian's vegetables with honey-miso sauce;

imdb.title: The Kitchen
plot: The lives of different families and how they cook different meals for each other.::georgeparrish14
